intro: Brassica praecox, commonly known as early cabbage, is an annual plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, head-like inflorescence that forms early in the growing season. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with dark green, lobed leaves that are hairy in texture. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in a raceme, typical of the mustard family. Brassica praecox is often cultivated for its edible leaves and is adapted to cooler climates.
